info.name: Oracle Fusion Cloud HCM - Worker Journeys
info.description:
REST API collection for Oracle Fusion Cloud HCM â€” Worker Journeys module.

Created by [Adrian Anderson](https://www.linkedin.com/in/aanderson1017/) | [YouTube - Better Human Applications](https://www.youtube.com/@BetterHumanApplications)

item.name: Worker Journeys

header.description: The protocol version between a REST client and service. If the client does not specify this header in the request the server will pick a default version for the API.

If the REST API supports runtime customizations, the shape of the service may change during runtime. The REST client may isolate itself from these changes or choose to interact with the latest version of the API by specifying this header. For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".

variable.description: (Required) The value of this parameter could be a hash of the key that is used to uniquely identify the resource item. The client should not generate the hash key value.  Instead, the client should query on the collection resource with a filter to navigate to a specific resource item. For example: products?q=InventoryItemId=<value1>

(Required) This is the hash key of the attributes which make up the composite key for the All Step Tasks resource and used to uniquely identify an instance of All Step Tasks. The client should not generate the hash key value. Instead, the client should query on the All Step Tasks collection resource in order to navigate to a specific instance of All Step Tasks to get the hash key.

query.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter specifies dependencies which are fields that are set before and rolled back after generating the response. Generally they are used to preview the effects of an attribute change. The fields specified in this parameter are always set in the resource instance in question. When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the fields will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency fields. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

Format: <attr1>=<val1>,<attr2>=<value2>

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

Example:
self,canonical

Example:

This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • ExpiryRelativeTo; string; Criteria based on which the task expires.
  • Name; string; Name of the journey task.
  • ParentWorkerJourneyId; integer; Unique identifier of the parent enterprise onboarding checklist.
  • PerformerPersonId; integer; Person identifier of the task performer. Applicable only in case of a single task performer.
  • RequiredFlag; boolean; Indicates whether the task is mandatory or optional. Valid values are Yes and No. The default value is No.
  • Status; string; Code for the task status.
  • TargetDuration; integer; Target duration for the task.
  • TargetDurationUOM; string; Unit of measure for the target duration.
  • WorkerJourneyTaskId; integer; Unique identifier of the journey task.

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables

  • PrimaryKey Finds all journey step tasks that match the primary key specified.
    Finder Variables
    • WorkerJourneyTaskId; integer; Unique identifier of the journey task.
  • findAssigneeTasks Finds all journey tasks for the journey assignee.
    Finder Variables
    • findAvailableOtherUserTasks Finds all available journey tasks for performers other than assignee and signed in user.
      Finder Variables
      • findAvailableOthersTasks Finds all journey tasks except deferred tasks for performers other than assignee and signed in user.
        Finder Variables
        • mPerformerPersonId; integer; Unique identifier for the performer other than assigned and signed in user to whom all tasks except deferred tasks are assigned in a journey step.
        • mPerformerUserguid; string; Internal identifier for the performer other than assignee and signed in user to whom all tasks except deferred tasks are assigned in a journey step.
        • mPerformerUsername; string; User name of the performer other than assignee and signed in user for whom all tasks except deferred tasks are assigned in a journey step.
        • mPersonId; integer; Identifier for the performer other than assignee and signed in user for whom all tasks except deferred tasks are assigned in a journey step.
        • mUserguid; string; Unique identifier for the performer other than assignee and signed in user for whom all tasks except deferred tasks are assigned in a journey step.
        • mUsername; string; User name of the worker other than assignee and signed in user for whom all tasks except deferred tasks are assigned in a journey step.
      • findAvailableSelfTasks Finds all journey tasks except deferred tasks for the signed in user.
        Finder Variables
        • findMyAvailableTasks Finds all available journey tasks for the logged in user.
          Finder Variables
          • findMyTasks Finds all journey tasks for the logged in user.
            Finder Variables
            • findOtherUserIncludingAssigneeTasks Finds all journey tasks for performers including those for journey assignee.
              Finder Variables
              • findOtherUserTasks Finds all journey tasks for performers other than assignee and signed in user.
                Finder Variables
                • findOthersIncludingAssigneeTasks Finds all journey tasks for performers including the journey assignee.
                  Finder Variables
                  • findOthersTasks Finds all journey tasks for performers other than assignee and signed in user.
                    Finder Variables
                    • findSelfTasks Finds all journey tasks for the signed in user.
                      Finder Variables
                      • findWorkerTasks Finds all journey tasks for the journey assignee.
                        Finder Variables

header.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, the server performs an Upsert operation instead of a Create operation. During an Upsert operation, the server attempts to find an existing resource that matches the payload. If a match is found, the server updates the existing resource instead of creating a new one. If not found or false (default), the server performs a Create operation. Note that the Upsert operation isn't supported for date-effective REST resources.

query.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter specifies dependencies which are fields that are set before and rolled back after generating the response. Generally they are used to preview the effects of an attribute change. The fields specified in this parameter are always set in the resource instance in question. When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the fields will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency fields. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

Format: <attr1>=<val1>,<attr2>=<value2>

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • Code; string; Code of the journey template property

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables

  • PrimaryKey Finds all journey properties that match the primary key specified.
    Finder Variables
    • Code; string; Unique identifier of the journey property.

query.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency fields. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • elearnType; string; Type of self-paced learning such as Video or SCORM. Valid values are defined in the list ContentTypeLOV.
  • elearnTypeMeaning; string; Description of the e-learn type.
  • learningItemId; integer; Unique identifier for the learning content item which is the internal primary key.
  • learningItemNumber; string; User-friendly number identifying the learning content item. It's a surrogate key which is shown in the UI.
  • learningItemTitle; string; Title of the learning content item.

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables

  • PrimaryKey Finds a learning content item that matches the primary key criteria specified.
    Finder Variables
    • findByWord Finds all the learning content items that match the search criteria.
      Finder Variables
      • FilterAttributes; string; Filter attributes for the search criteria.
      • SearchTerms; string; Search term criteria to retrieve data.
      • StartsWithFlag; boolean; Indicates whether data that starts with the search term should be retrieved.
      • learningItemTitle; string; Title of the learning content item.

query.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter specifies dependencies which are fields that are set before and rolled back after generating the response. Generally they are used to preview the effects of an attribute change. The fields specified in this parameter are always set in the resource instance in question. When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the fields will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency fields. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

Format: <attr1>=<val1>,<attr2>=<value2>

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

Example:
self,canonical

header.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, the server performs an Upsert operation instead of a Create operation. During an Upsert operation, the server attempts to find an existing resource that matches the payload. If a match is found, the server updates the existing resource instead of creating a new one. If not found or false (default), the server performs a Create operation. Note that the Upsert operation isn't supported for date-effective REST resources.

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • AuthenticationFormat; string; Password authentication format for an electronic signature task.
  • JourneyTaskId; integer; Identifier of the journey task.
  • LearningContentTypeMeaning; string; Meaning of the learning content type.
  • Name; string; Name of the journey task.
  • PerformerPersonId; integer; Person identifier of the task performer. Available only in case of single performer, is updatable when adding a new task.
  • ProcessingMode; string; Processing mode to send journey notifications.
  • RequiredFlag; boolean; Indicates whether the task is mandatory or optional. Valid values are Yes and No. The default value is No.
  • SaveAttachmentsToDORForMeaning; string; Meaning of save attachments to document records.
  • Status; string; Status code of the task.
  • TargetDurationUOMMeaning; string; Meaning of unit of measure used in the task target duration.
  • VideoTypeMeaning; string; Meaning of video type.
  • WorkerJourneyTaskId; integer; Unique identifier of the journey task.

    Finder Variables
    • findAvailableSelfTasks Finds all journey tasks except deferred tasks for the signed in user.
      Finder Variables
      • findOthersTasks Finds all journey tasks for users other than the signed in user and journey assignee.
        Finder Variables
        • findSelfTasks Finds all journey tasks for the signed in user.
          Finder Variables
          • findWorkerTasks Finds all journey tasks for the journey assignee.
            Finder Variables

Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • AttachedDocumentId; integer; Unique identifier of the attachment. System generated primary key.
  • CategoryName; string; Category of the attachment.
  • CreatedBy; string; User who created the attachment.
  • CreatedByUserName; string; Name of the user who created the attachment.
  • CreationDate; string; Date and time when the attachment record was created.
  • DatatypeCode; string; Value that indicates data type code of attachment.
  • DmDocumentId; string; Unique identifier of the attachment.
  • DmFolderPath; string; Folder path of the attachment.
  • DmVersionNumber; string; Version number of the attachment.
  • DocumentPreviewURL; string; Attachment context.
  • ExpirationDate; string; Expiration date and time of the attachment content.
  • FileName; string; File name of the attachment.
  • LastUpdateDate; string; Date and time when the attachment was last updated.
  • LastUpdatedBy; string; User who last updated the attachment.
  • LastUpdatedByUserName; string; Name of the user who last updated the attachment.
  • Uri; string; URI of the attachment.
  • Url; string; URL of the attachment.
  • UserName; string; User name associated with the attachment.

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables

  • PrimaryKey Finds all job application attachments by primary key.
    Finder Variables
    • AttachedDocumentId; integer; Primary key and attachment document identifier used to find job application attachments.

This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • AnswerCode; string; The answer code that a participant chose when responding to a single choice question.
  • AnswerCodeList; string; Concatenated list of answer choices, separated by a semicolon as a delimiter, which is selected by the participant when responding to a multiple choice question.
  • AnswerComments; string; Additional comments provided by the participant when responding to a question.
  • AnswerList; string; Concatenated list of answer identifiers, separated by a semicolon as a delimiter, which is selected by the participant when responding to a multiple choice question.
  • ChoiceCodeList; string; Concatenated list of answer codes, separated by a semicolon as a delimiter, which are presented to the participant when responding to a question enabled for random order responses.
  • CreatedBy; string; User who created the question response.
  • CreationDate; string; Date on which the question response was created.
  • LastUpdateDate; string; Date on which the question response was updated.
  • LastUpdatedBy; string; User who last updated the question response.
  • QuestionAnswerId; integer; Surrogate identifier of the answer that a participant chose when responding to a single choice question.
  • QuestionCode; string; Alphanumeric value that uniquely identifies a question defined for a subscriber.
  • QuestionId; integer; Surrogate identifier for the question.
  • QuestionResponseId; integer; Surrogate identifier for the question response.
  • QuestionnaireQuestionId; integer; Surrogate identifier for the question in a questionnaire.

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables

  • PrimaryKey Finds responses for all the questions in a questionnaire.
    Finder Variables
    • QuestionResponseId; integer; Unique identifier for the question response.

header.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, the server performs an Upsert operation instead of a Create operation. During an Upsert operation, the server attempts to find an existing resource that matches the payload. If a match is found, the server updates the existing resource instead of creating a new one. If not found or false (default), the server performs a Create operation. Note that the Upsert operation isn't supported for date-effective REST resources.
The protocol version between a REST client and service. If the client does not specify this header in the request the server will pick a default version for the API.

If the REST API supports runtime customizations, the shape of the service may change during runtime. The REST client may isolate itself from these changes or choose to interact with the latest version of the API by specifying this header. For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".

query.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter specifies dependencies which are fields that are set before and rolled back after generating the response. Generally they are used to preview the effects of an attribute change. The fields specified in this parameter are always set in the resource instance in question. When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the fields will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency fields. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

Format: <attr1>=<val1>,<attr2>=<value2>

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

Example:
self,canonical
This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • AttachedDocumentId; integer; Unique identifier of the attached document.
  • CategoryName; string; Category name of the attachment. This is a read-only attribute.
  • CreatedBy; string; User who created the attachment.
  • CreatedByUserName; string; User name of the user who created the attachment.
  • CreationDate; string; Date on which the attachment was created.
  • DatatypeCode; string; Attachment type supported for the question. Only the attachment type, FILE, is supported.
  • DmDocumentId; string; Surrogate identifier of the document attached to the questionnaire.
  • DmFolderPath; string; Path of the folder.
  • DmVersionNumber; string; Version number of the attachment.
  • ExpirationDate; string; Expiration date of the attachment. This is a read-only attribute.
  • FileName; string; Name of the attachment file.
  • LastUpdateDate; string; Date on which the attachment was last updated.
  • LastUpdatedBy; string; User who last updated the attachment.
  • LastUpdatedByUserName; string; Name of the user who last updated the attachment record.
  • Uri; string; URI of the attachment. This is a read-only attribute.
  • Url; string; URL of a web page attachment.
  • UserName; string; User name of the person who uploaded the attachment.

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables

  • PrimaryKey Finds all attachments added as response to a question.
    Finder Variables
    • AttachedDocumentId; integer; Unique identifier for the attachment added to a question.

This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

query.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the fields will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency fields. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

Format: <attr1>=<val1>,<attr2>=<value2>

header.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, the server performs an Upsert operation instead of a Create operation. During an Upsert operation, the server attempts to find an existing resource that matches the payload. If a match is found, the server updates the existing resource instead of creating a new one. If not found or false (default), the server performs a Create operation. Note that the Upsert operation isn't supported for date-effective REST resources.

This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • AccessLevel; string; Access level of a journey template.
  • ActionDate; string; Date as of which the journey is allocated.
  • AllocationDate; string; Date on which the journey is initiated.
  • BackgroundImageURL; string; URL of the image displayed on the journey card and journey details page.
  • Category; string; Category code of the journey.
  • Code; string; Code for the journey template.
  • Context; string; Context for a journey.
  • ContextualAction; string; Transaction flow for which the contextual journey is applicable.
  • CountryCode; string; Code of the country to which the journey is applicable.
  • DisplayType; string; Display type of the guided journey.
  • InitiatorDisplayName; string; Display name of the journey initiator.
  • Instance; string; Instance of the allocated journey to identify if the same journey is allocated to the worker multiple times.
  • JourneyId; integer; Identifier of the journey.
  • Level; string; Level of a journey template.
  • LevelValue; integer; Value of journey template level such as global or personal.
  • Name; string; Name of the journey.
  • PersonId; integer; Internal identifier of the journey assignee.
  • Status; string; Status code of the worker journey.
  • SubCategory; string; Subcategory of the worker journey.
  • WorkerJourneyId; integer; Primary key generated by the application.

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables

  • PrimaryKey Finds all journeys that match the primary key specified.
    Finder Variables
    • WorkerJourneyId; integer; Unique identifier of the journey.
  • findAllReportsJourneys Finds all journeys assigned to all reports of the current signed in user and restricted by the person security profile.
    Finder Variables
    • CategoryFilter; string; Attribute to filter journeys assigned to all reports of the current signed in user by category.
    • Facets; string; Facet names to group search results for journeys assigned to all reports of the current signed in user.
    • SearchTerms; string; Search criteria to find journeys assigned to all reports of the current signed in user.
    • StatusFilter; string; Attribute to filter journeys assigned to all reports of the current signed in user by status.
    • SubCategoryFilter; string; Filter attribute to retrieve journeys assigned to all reports of the current signed in user by subcategory.
  • findByJourneyId Finds all the journeys based on the journey identifier.
    Finder Variables
    • AllocatedAfterDate; string; Filter attribute to retrieve journeys that are assigned after a specific date.
    • JourneyId; integer; Filter attribute to retrieve journeys based on the journey identifier.
    • Overdue; string; Filter attribute to retrieve journeys that are overdue.
    • StatusCategory; string; Filter attribute to retrieve journeys based on the status category.
  • findDirectReportsJourneys Finds all journeys assigned to direct reports of the current signed in user and restricted by the person security profile.
    Finder Variables
    • CategoryFilter; string; Attribute to filter journeys assigned to direct reports of the current signed in user by category.
    • Facets; string; Facet names to group search results for journeys assigned to direct reports of the current signed in user.
    • SearchTerms; string; Search criteria to find journeys assigned to direct reports of the current signed in user.
    • StatusFilter; string; Attribute to filter journeys assigned to direct reports of the current signed in user by status.
    • SubCategoryFilter; string; Filter attribute to retrieve journeys assigned to direct reports of the current signed in user by subcategory.
  • findOpenContextualJourneys Finds all open contextual journeys.
    Finder Variables
    • AssignmentId; integer; Filter attribute to retrieve contextual journeys based on assignment identifier.
    • Context; string; Filter attribute to retrieve contextual journeys based on context.
    • ContextualAction; string; Filter attribute to retrieve contextual journeys based on the transaction flow.
    • PersonId; integer; Filter attribute to retrieve contextual journeys based on person identifier.
  • findOthersJourneys Finds all journeys assigned to workers other than the current signed in user and restricted by the person security profile.
    Finder Variables
    • CategoryFilter; string; Attribute to filter journeys assigned to workers other than the current signed in user by category.
    • Facets; string; Facet names to group search results for journeys assigned to workers other than the current signed in user.
    • FilterAttributes; string; Filter attribute to retrieve journeys assigned to workers other than the current signed in user.
    • PersonId; integer; Attribute to filter journeys assigned to workers other than the current signed in user by person identifier.
    • SearchTerms; string; Search criteria to find journeys assigned to workers other than the current signed in user.
    • StatusFilter; string; Attribute to filter journeys assigned to workers other than the current signed in user by status.
    • SubCategoryFilter; string; Filter attribute to retrieve journeys assigned to workers other than the current signed in user by subcategory.
  • findSelfJourneys Finds all journeys assigned to the signed in user.
    Finder Variables
    • CategoryFilter; string; Attribute to filter journeys assigned to the current signed in user by category.
    • CodeFilter; string; Filter attribute to retrieve journeys assigned to the current signed in user by code.
    • Facets; string; Facet names to group search results for journeys assigned to the current signed in user.
    • SearchTerms; string; Search criteria to find journeys assigned the current signed in user.
    • StatusFilter; string; Attribute to filter journeys assigned to the current signed in user by status.
    • SubCategoryFilter; string; Filter attribute to retrieve journeys assigned to the current signed in user by subcategory.

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

Example:
self,canonical
This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • AccessLevel; string; Access level of a journey template.
  • ActionDate; string; Date as of which the journey is allocated.
  • AllocationDate; string; Date on which the journey is initiated.
  • BackgroundImageURL; string; URL of the image displayed on the journey card and journey details page.
  • Category; string; Category code of the journey.
  • Code; string; Code for the journey template.
  • Context; string; Context for a journey.
  • ContextualAction; string; Transaction flow for which the contextual journey is applicable.
  • CountryCode; string; Code of the country to which the journey is applicable.
  • DisplayType; string; Display type of the guided journey.
  • InitiatorDisplayName; string; Display name of the journey initiator.
  • Instance; string; Instance of the allocated journey to identify if the same journey is allocated to the worker multiple times.
  • JourneyId; integer; Identifier of the journey.
  • Level; string; Level of a journey template.
  • LevelValue; integer; Value of journey template level such as global or personal.
  • Name; string; Name of the journey.
  • PersonId; integer; Internal identifier of the journey assignee.
  • Status; string; Status code of the worker journey.
  • SubCategory; string; Subcategory of the worker journey.
  • WorkerJourneyId; integer; Primary key generated by the application.

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables

  • PrimaryKey Finds all journeys that match the primary key specified.
    Finder Variables
    • WorkerJourneyId; integer; Unique identifier of the journey.
  • findAllReportsJourneys Finds all journeys assigned to all reports of the current signed in user and restricted by the person security profile.
    Finder Variables
    • CategoryFilter; string; Attribute to filter journeys assigned to all reports of the current signed in user by category.
    • Facets; string; Facet names to group search results for journeys assigned to all reports of the current signed in user.
    • SearchTerms; string; Search criteria to find journeys assigned to all reports of the current signed in user.
    • StatusFilter; string; Attribute to filter journeys assigned to all reports of the current signed in user by status.
    • SubCategoryFilter; string; Filter attribute to retrieve journeys assigned to all reports of the current signed in user by subcategory.
  • findByJourneyId Finds all the journeys based on the journey identifier.
    Finder Variables
    • AllocatedAfterDate; string; Filter attribute to retrieve journeys that are assigned after a specific date.
    • JourneyId; integer; Filter attribute to retrieve journeys based on the journey identifier.
    • Overdue; string; Filter attribute to retrieve journeys that are overdue.
    • StatusCategory; string; Filter attribute to retrieve journeys based on the status category.
  • findDirectReportsJourneys Finds all journeys assigned to direct reports of the current signed in user and restricted by the person security profile.
    Finder Variables
    • CategoryFilter; string; Attribute to filter journeys assigned to direct reports of the current signed in user by category.
    • Facets; string; Facet names to group search results for journeys assigned to direct reports of the current signed in user.
    • SearchTerms; string; Search criteria to find journeys assigned to direct reports of the current signed in user.
    • StatusFilter; string; Attribute to filter journeys assigned to direct reports of the current signed in user by status.
    • SubCategoryFilter; string; Filter attribute to retrieve journeys assigned to direct reports of the current signed in user by subcategory.
  • findOpenContextualJourneys Finds all open contextual journeys.
    Finder Variables
    • AssignmentId; integer; Filter attribute to retrieve contextual journeys based on assignment identifier.
    • Context; string; Filter attribute to retrieve contextual journeys based on context.
    • ContextualAction; string; Filter attribute to retrieve contextual journeys based on the transaction flow.
    • PersonId; integer; Filter attribute to retrieve contextual journeys based on person identifier.
  • findOthersJourneys Finds all journeys assigned to workers other than the current signed in user and restricted by the person security profile.
    Finder Variables
    • CategoryFilter; string; Attribute to filter journeys assigned to workers other than the current signed in user by category.
    • Facets; string; Facet names to group search results for journeys assigned to workers other than the current signed in user.
    • FilterAttributes; string; Filter attribute to retrieve journeys assigned to workers other than the current signed in user.
    • PersonId; integer; Attribute to filter journeys assigned to workers other than the current signed in user by person identifier.
    • SearchTerms; string; Search criteria to find journeys assigned to workers other than the current signed in user.
    • StatusFilter; string; Attribute to filter journeys assigned to workers other than the current signed in user by status.
    • SubCategoryFilter; string; Filter attribute to retrieve journeys assigned to workers other than the current signed in user by subcategory.
  • findSelfJourneys Finds all journeys assigned to the signed in user.
    Finder Variables
    • CategoryFilter; string; Attribute to filter journeys assigned to the current signed in user by category.
    • CodeFilter; string; Filter attribute to retrieve journeys assigned to the current signed in user by code.
    • Facets; string; Facet names to group search results for journeys assigned to the current signed in user.
    • SearchTerms; string; Search criteria to find journeys assigned the current signed in user.
    • StatusFilter; string; Attribute to filter journeys assigned to the current signed in user by status.
    • SubCategoryFilter; string; Filter attribute to retrieve journeys assigned to the current signed in user by subcategory.

item.description: The workerJourneys resource includes all the journeys of a worker.
